data.title: Playing individual Quo tracks or Singles
data.meta_description: It suddenly struck me today when streaming a Quo track on the Amazon Echo at home that I have a few “go to” Quo tracks when I play random music at home  If it’s post 80’s it’ll be  Ok Rag
data.text:
Post by craydarr on

It suddenly struck me today when streaming a Quo track on the Amazon Echo at home that I have a few “go to” Quo tracks when I play random music at home

If it’s post 80’s it’ll be

Ok Rag Blues

And It’s Better Now acoustic

Little White Lies

With Gravy Train or Bad news as close follow up

Or pre 80’s

Paper Plane

In My Chair

Wild Side Of Life

Lonely night

Anybody else have go to tracks that’s they play regularly?

Post by mortified on

It's funny because Lonely Night has become one of my go to songs as well. I just love the whole laid back groove of the thing. More so now than I did in 1974!

I also always turn to Breaking Away and Coming And Going. And Mrs Mortified has made me appreciate Accident Prone more. It's a favourite of hers and we watch the video of it quite a lot.

For more modern stuff, there's no doubt Two Way Traffic gets a regular airing and also The Madness. Or, as it's known in this house, Kylie v The Beachboys

Post by craydarr on

It's funny because Lonely Night has become one of my go to songs as well. I just love the whole laid back groove of the thing. More so now than I did in 1974!

I also always turn to Breaking Away and Coming And Going. And Mrs Mortified has made me appreciate Accident Prone more. It's a favourite of hers and we watch the video of it quite a lot.

For more modern stuff, there's no doubt Two Way Traffic gets a regular airing and also The Madness. Or, as it's known in this house, Kylie v The Beachboys

I love Johns drumming on Lonely night, one of his best for me.

Accident Prone is a great track, one I should play more often as I do love it.

I’m funny with 2 Way Traffic as I do love it but I don’t play it very often unless I put the whole album on, I think it’s something to do with the fact I played it so much when it came out.

Post by craydarr on

I tend to go to these tracks for some reason

I'm watching over you ( I like to sift through the b-sides and rarities)

Can't give you more (RAOTW album)

What to do.

Face the music.

I love Face the Music and I play that reasonably often at home, I’m not really a big fan of Can’t Give You More as it always comes across as a bit of Quo by numbers for me.

Do you prefer the RAOTW version to the RTYD version then?

Post by Isaac Ryan on

I tend to go to these tracks for some reason

I'm watching over you ( I like to sift through the b-sides and rarities)

Can't give you more (RAOTW album)

What to do.

Face the music.

I love Face the Music and I play that reasonably often at home, I’m not really a big fan of Can’t Give You More as it always comes across as a bit of Quo by numbers for me.

Do you prefer the RAOTW version to the RTYD version then?

Yes, I have always loved the earlier version over the newer. I was a young lad when RAOTW was released played the album loads.

Post by mortified on

Just joining in, I've always preferred the original version of Can't Give You More.

In fact, I can't think of any track that has been improved by re-recording it and never really saw the point. Aquostic apart that is. I suppose Running All Over The World took the track up a notch but it was never best first time round. Despite it's success and legacy!

Post by Isaac Ryan on

It's funny because Lonely Night has become one of my go to songs as well. I just love the whole laid back groove of the thing. More so now than I did in 1974!

I also always turn to Breaking Away and Coming And Going. And Mrs Mortified has made me appreciate Accident Prone more. It's a favourite of hers and we watch the video of it quite a lot.

For more modern stuff, there's no doubt Two Way Traffic gets a regular airing and also The Madness. Or, as it's known in this house, Kylie v The Beachboys

With you on "The Madness" play it a lot. Also Lucinda, Analyse Time, She Knew Too Much.

Post by mortified on

It's funny because Lonely Night has become one of my go to songs as well. I just love the whole laid back groove of the thing. More so now than I did in 1974!

I also always turn to Breaking Away and Coming And Going. And Mrs Mortified has made me appreciate Accident Prone more. It's a favourite of hers and we watch the video of it quite a lot.

For more modern stuff, there's no doubt Two Way Traffic gets a regular airing and also The Madness. Or, as it's known in this house, Kylie v The Beachboys

With you on "The Madness" play it a lot. Also Lucinda, Analyse Time, She Knew Too Much.

That's an unusual one. Not very well known.

Very un-Quo like. I was never 100% sure of it. That and Survival. Both a bit left field but then Mr Bown was involved, so I tend to expect the unexpected

Both have grown on me considerably. But it's taken almost 30 years

Post by Isaac Ryan on

With you on "The Madness" play it a lot. Also Lucinda, Analyse Time, She Knew Too Much.

That's an unusual one. Not very well known.

Very un-Quo like. I was never 100% sure of it. That and Survival. Both a bit left field but then Mr Bown was involved, so I tend to expect the unexpected

Both have grown on me considerably. But it's taken almost 30 years

I do find myself scrolling through the B sides and rarities quite often. SKTM always gets an airing, I don't know what pulls me towards it, I know I usually find myself singing the chorus for the rest of the day

Post by craydarr on

It's funny because Lonely Night has become one of my go to songs as well. I just love the whole laid back groove of the thing. More so now than I did in 1974!

I also always turn to Breaking Away and Coming And Going. And Mrs Mortified has made me appreciate Accident Prone more. It's a favourite of hers and we watch the video of it quite a lot.

For more modern stuff, there's no doubt Two Way Traffic gets a regular airing and also The Madness. Or, as it's known in this house, Kylie v The Beachboys

With you on "The Madness" play it a lot. Also Lucinda, Analyse Time, She Knew Too Much.

I need to go back and play The Madness as it’s one I haven’t heard for a long time.

Analyse Time is a good one, not too bothered about She Knew Too Much tho.

And I actually very much prefer Rhinos live version of Lucinda, off his charge album.

Post by craydarr on

Good topic.

For post 86 I go for

Army

Go Go Go

Liberty Lane

Warning Shot

Pre 86

Accident Prone (one of my all time faves)

Oh Baby

Who Asked You

Down, Down

I stupidly forgot Liberty Lane as that’s a real fave for me and I listen to it regularly. If we are on Backbone tracks then there’s Better Take Care and Waiting For A Woman which I play semi regularly.

I do love Warning Shot but hardly ever play it. Note to self 🤔

Post by mortified on

The revisiting of B-sides is something I might do at some point.

The vast majority, especially during the Thirsty Work period, I never gave much attention once I'd played them once or twice. They just weren't for me.

Other B-sides have grown on me a great deal over the years (Joanne, You Lost The Love, Gone Thru The Slips) so maybe an Aladdin's Cave awaits.

I'm nothing if not optimistic

Post by Isaac Ryan on

The vast majority, especially during the Thirsty Work period, I never gave much attention once I'd played them once or twice. They just weren't for me.

Other B-sides have grown on me a great deal over the years (Joanne, You Lost The Love, Gone Thru The Slips) so maybe an Aladdin's Cave awaits.

I'm nothing if not optimistic

Go for it Morty, Better Times, Heavy Daze, You let me down, Obstruction Day, I'll never get over you, I knew the bride. Just a few for starters.

These are different. These are top notch and have been played endlessly over the years It was never all bad. Even Sea Cruise. I don't know, I just like it

And Mortified

Mortified ain't too bad

Post by craydarr on

The revisiting of B-sides is something I might do at some point.

The vast majority, especially during the Thirsty Work period, I never gave much attention once I'd played them once or twice. They just weren't for me.

Other B-sides have grown on me a great deal over the years (Joanne, You Lost The Love, Gone Thru The Slips) so maybe an Aladdin's Cave awaits.

I'm nothing if not optimistic

Go for it Morty, Better Times, Heavy Daze, You let me down, Obstruction Day, I'll never get over you, I knew the bride. Just a few for starters.

I actually like all of those, although You Let Me Down is a classic Quo song for me and should have been an album track.

Post by mortified on

Just given Lean Machine a spin, thoughts?

I liked Lean Machine at the time. Still do.

Most of the B-sides back then were OK. This one drives along nicely. In fact, if I'm honest, the B-sides tended to be better than most of what ended up on the albums, especially Ain't Complaining.

A Parfitt/Rossi composition which became an increasing rarity and wasn't that common even back then.

Post by Isaac Ryan on

Just given Lean Machine a spin, thoughts?

I haven’t heard it for a while but I loved it when it came out. Darn it, I’m going to have to dig it out now and have a listen.

How about “The reason for goodbye” ?

Post by craydarr on

I haven’t heard it for a while but I loved it when it came out. Darn it, I’m going to have to dig it out now and have a listen.

How about “The reason for goodbye” ?

Love it, Love it, Love it👍

The only negative I would say is about the crappy 80s production on it.
